questions.question: A train moving at 72 km/h crosses a 500-meter-long bridge in 50 seconds. What is the length of the train?
A car covers 40 km at 80 km/h and the next 60 km at 120 km/h. What is the average speed?
A clock shows 4:40 PM. What is the angle between the hour and minute hands?
A clock gains 10 minutes every 2 hours. If it was correct at 6:00 AM, what will be the actual time when it shows 9:00 AM?
A person walks 10 km north, then 5 km east, then 3 km south. How far is he from the starting point?
A man faces south. He turns 45° clockwise and then 180° anti-clockwise. What is his final direction?
A shopkeeper marks an item 25% above cost price and allows a 10% discount. What is his profit percentage?
A person sells two items at the same price, making 20% profit on one and 20% loss on the other. What is the overall gain/loss?
Pointing to a man, a woman says, 'His mother is the only daughter of my mother.' How is the man related to the woman?
A is the father of B, C is the son of B, D is the brother of C, and E is the mother of D. How is E related to A?
A can complete a task in 15 days, and B can complete it in 10 days. How long will it take them to complete it together?
A tap fills a tank in 12 hours, while another tap empties it in 18 hours. How long will it take to fill the tank if both taps are open?
Find the missing number: 2, 6, 12, 20, __, 42
What comes next? 1, 4, 9, 16, 25, __
A bag contains 5 red, 4 blue, and 3 green balls. What is the probability of drawing a blue ball?
How many ways can the letters in 'APPLE' be arranged?
A rectangle has an area of 72 cm², and its length is twice its width. Find its length.
A right-angled triangle has a base of 6 cm and height of 8 cm. Find its hypotenuse.
If 'BREAD' is coded as 'YVZIW', how is 'WATER' coded?
Arrange in logical sequence: 1. Planting → 2. Watering → 3. Growing → 4. Harvesting
